form.field.nickname.tooltip: What do you want others to call you?
form.rules.confirmPassword.different: The two passwords that you entered do not match!
form.rules.email.valid: The input is not valid E-mail!
calc.ex_500.name: ZZ EX500
calc.innov_eyes.name: ZZ InnovEyes
calc.innov_eyes.instructions: Mani S=Manifest Spherical Power, Mani C=Manifest Cylinder Power,  4mm S/C & Default Detail S/C=Obtained from EX500, Treat S/C=Treatment S/C, Detail S/C=Detail S/C After Treat S/C inputed
calc.iol.name: ZZ IOL
calc.iol.instructions:
Selection of IOL (Intra-ocula Lens) for normal cornea
to calculate the IOL refraction
calc.iol.notes:
SE=Spherical Equivalent
AL=Axial Length
ACD=Anterior Chambler Depth (External)
LT=Lens Thickness
PP=Puple Power (4mm) (Available from CSO Sirius or Zeus) [Theoretically equivalent to TCRP (Total Corneal Refractive Power)]
CCT=Central Corneal Thickness
calc.iol_toric.name: ZZ TIOL
calc.iol_toric.instructions:
Selection of Toric IOL (Intra-ocula Lens) for normal cornea
to calculate the Toric IOL refraction and axis
calc.iol_toric.notes:
SE=Spherical Equivalent
AL=Axial Length
ACD=Anterior Chambler Depth (External)
LT=Lens Thickness
PP=Puple Power (4mm) (Available from CSO Sirius or Zeus) [Theoretically equivalent to TCRP (Total Corneal Refractive Power)]
Corn Asti=Corneal Astigmatism (4mm)
SIA=Surgically Induced Astigmatism
CCT=Central Corneal Thickness
calc.iol_pro.name: ZZ IOL Pro (Self filling is not available)
calc.iol_pro.instructions:
Selection of various corneal IOL
Upload the value of A constant, Target D, AL, LT and the raw data of corneal tomographic is needed
calc.iol_pro.notes:
AL=Axial Length
LT=Lens Thickness
SE=Sperical Equivalant
AC=Anterior Chambler Depth (Internal)
calc.iol_pro.rawdata: Currently only CSO Sirius or Zeus .zcs documents are supported (include more than 5 repeatable results)
calc.iol_pro.pay: RMB 200 Each (After the payment is successful, the result will be given within 48 hours)
calc.iol_plus.name: ZZ IOL Pro (Self filling is not available)
calc.iol_plus.instructions:
Selection of various corneal IOL
Upload the value of A constant, Target D, AL, LT and the raw data of corneal tomographic is needed
calc.iol_plus.notes:
AL=Axial Length
LT=Lens Thickness
SE=Sperical Equivalant
AC=Anterior Chambler Depth (Internal)
calc.iol_plus.rawdata: Currently only CSO Sirius or Zeus .zcs documents are supported (include more than 5 repeatable results)
calc.iol_plus.pay: RMB 200 Each (After the payment is successful, the result will be given within 48 hours)
calc.ar.name: ZZ ARp (Auto-compensation Refraction) Calculator
calc.ar.instructions:
Used to assist surgical strategy planning for Topo-Guide refractive surgery
By calculating the compensation diopter while correcting HOAs for virgin cornea
calc.ar.notes:
Mani=Manifested
Corn-P=Corneal Posterior surface
TMR=Topogray Modified Refraction
Res=Reserved
AR=After Auto-compensation (No Nomogramm)
calc.vr.name: ZZ VR (Vector-compensation Refraction) Calculator
calc.vr.instructions:
Used to assist surgical strategy planning for Topo-Guide / Wavefront-Guide refractive surgery
By calculating the compensation diopter while correcting HOAs for virgin cornea
calc.vr.notes:
C7~C13=Corresponded HOAs under selected Opic Zone in the excimer device, Optical Society of America(OSA) Standard (μm)
Mani=Manifest refraction
VR=After vector-compensation (No Nomogramm)
calc.vr_pro.name: ZZ VR (Vector-compensation Refraction) Pro Calculator
calc.vr_pro.instructions: Used to assist surgical strategy planning for Topo-Guide / Wavefront-Guide refractive surgery, By calculating the compensation diopter while correcting HOAs for special treatment
calc.vr_pro.notes:
C7~C13=Corresponded HOAs under selected Opic Zone in the excimer device, Optical Society of America(OSA) Standard (μm)
Mani=Manifest refraction
VR=After vector-compensation (No Nomogramm)
calc.lsa_qd.name: ZZ LSA Q.D.
calc.lsa_qd.instructions:
Design of surgical strategy for Q-value guide refractive surgery
To calculate the ΔQ and the compensated diopter, for obtaining the expected ΔLSA (Longitudinal Spherical Aberration, Diopter)
calc.lsa_qd.notes:
Kf=Tangential Curvature
e=ecc of cornea (5mm)
PSA=primary spherical aberration (5mm)
Biomechanical changes have been taken into account in the target Q (PostOP-1m Q=target Q+0.3)
Q. D. =Compensated Diopter, when the Q-value is changed
calc.qd.name: ZZ Q.D.
calc.qd.instructions:
Design of surgical strategy for Q-value guide refractive surgery
To calculate the compensated diopter, when the Q-value is changed.
calc.qd.notes:
SD=Spherical Diopter
e=ecc of cornea
Target D=D after compensation
calc.icl.name: ZZ ICL
calc.icl.instructions:
Selection of ICL(Implantable Collamer Lens)
To calculate the ICL refraction and estimated vaulting hight
calc.icl.notes:
Mani=Manifest refraction
CT=Corneal Thickness
AC=Anterior Chambler Depth (Internal)
LT=Lens Thickness
STS=Sulcus to Sulcus
H/V=Horizontal / Vertical
ICL Ax=Direction of ICL major axis
SIA=Surgically Induced Astigmatism
calc.icl_vault.name: ZZ ICL Vault
calc.icl_vault.instructions:
Selection of ICL (Implantable Collamer Lens) Diameter
To estimated vaulting hight after ICL implantation
calc.icl_vault.notes:
LT=Lens Thickness
ICL Ax=Direction of ICL major axis
STS=Sulcus to Sulcus
H/V=Horizontal / Vertical
calc.ticl_rotation.name: ZZ TICL Rotation
calc.ticl_rotation.instructions:
Design of surgical strategy for adjustment of TICL(Toric Implantable Collamer Lens) axis error
To calculate the adjustment direction and angle of TICL in the current state, in order to reduce the residual astigmatism
calc.ticl_rotation.notes:
No new main incision
no replacement of TICL
Mani=Manifest refraction before TICL implantation
Resi=Residual manifest refraction after TICL implantation
SIA=Surgically Induced Astigmatism
calc.pc_prl.name: PC-PRL Refraction Calculator
calc.pc_prl.instructions:
Selection of PC-PRL
To calculate the PC-PRL refraction
calc.sia.name: ZZ SIA (Surgically Induced Astigmatism) Calculator
calc.sia.instructions: Used to calculate the diopter after introducing SIA
calc.vector_sum_sub.name: ZZ Vector-Refraction Calculator
calc.vector_sum_sub.instructions: Used to calculate the vector-sum or vector-substraction of two diopters
calc.mean_sd_vector.name: ZZ Mean ± SD (Standard Deviation) of Vector-refraction Calculator
calc.mean_sd_vector.instructions: Used to calculate the Mean ± SD of multiple diopters
calc.ex_500_opmi.name: ZZ EX500 Visual Axis Tracking Calculator
calc.ex_500_opmi.instructions: Adjust aiming beam according to ZZ EX500 method, to make ablation centered on the optic axis
calc.ex_500_opmi.notes:
K=Tangential curvature of corneal vertical axis
G-R=Distance between Green dot and Red dot
calc.ok_glasses.name: ZZ OK (Orthokeratoloy) Lens Fitting Calculator for Central Area Abnormal Cornea
calc.ok_glasses.notes:
K (9mm)=Mean tangential curvature of 9mm of corneal flat axis
AC=Simulated Sim-K of normal cornea
